name: Private Halford

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: {Desparate, relieved}Oh, thank God! I didn't think I'd ever see another human face down here.

topics.topic_text: What are you talking about?
topics.response_text: {Relieved}You must be the backup I've been calling for. Where are the rest of your men?

topics.topic_text: I heard your radio broadcast. I'm here to help.
topics.response_text: Thank God. I hoped someone would come eventually, but where are the rest of your men?

topics.topic_text: This is it, buddy.
topics.response_text: {Urgent}Shit. Have you any damn idea what lives in these caves!? We need to get out of...{cut short realizing he's yelling}

topics.topic_text: What killed the other troopers?
topics.response_text: {anxious}I don't know. Some kind of man-fish freak like the one I killed over there.

topics.topic_text: Are you okay?
topics.response_text: I managed to kill that thing, but not before it mangled my leg all up. No way I'm walking out of here like this.

topics.topic_text: How did you kill that thing?
topics.response_text: With my bare hands. I would have shot it, but I was cleaning my gun when they swarmed the camp.

topics.topic_text: Looks like some nasty lacerations and a dislocated joint. You're lucky I found you.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] Thanks a lot, doc. I think I should be able to walk out of here, now.

topics.topic_text: <Use Doctor Bag to heal his leg> This should help fix up your leg.
topics.response_text: Thanks a lot, doc. Looks like I should be able to at least walk out of here, now.

topics.topic_text: I'll be back.
topics.response_text: Great, just leave me here, then.

topics.topic_text: That's a nice gun you've got there.
topics.response_text: You can have it if you get me out of here alive. I won't have a use for it when I get back to California.

topics.topic_text: You're free to leave. The way up is clear.
topics.response_text: Great, I'll start heading back to California now. I'm not about to let myself get killed by future NCR incompetence.

topics.topic_text: We need to clear the caves first.
topics.response_text: Are you crazy? No way in hell am I going deeper into these caves.

topics.topic_text: If we don't clear the caves, your friends' deaths were for nothing. Can you live with that?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] All right, you have a point. They were good men and deserved better.

topics.topic_text: Let's get moving.
topics.response_text: Lead on.

topics.topic_text: Hey, you said you would help clear the caves.
topics.response_text: I know, but now that I can see the way out, I'm not so sure. I'd rather not join my dead buddies anytime soon.

topics.topic_text: <Raise arms>Boogedy boogedy boo!
topics.response_text: {Fearful, surprised}Ahhh!...

topics.topic_text: Well, have a safe trip.
topics.response_text: If you find my friends, please return their dogtags to the NCR. People need to know what happened here.

topics.topic_text: You said I could have your rifle before you go.
topics.response_text: Sure enough, you got me clear of this mess. Here you go.

conversation.response_text: {Triumphant, taunting the dead}Ha! How do you like that you sons of bitches?!

combat.response_text: {Hushed, urgent, impatient}Bravo, come in, Bravo. Is anyone out there?

description:
Private Halford is a 28 year-old Caucasian Male.

A battle-weary New California Republic Army military policeman who bears the physical and emotional scars of a brutal lakelurk attack. Private Halford can be found injured in the Camp Guardian caves, where he has been surviving alone for an unknown period after his entire squad was wiped out.

Private Halford's Personality: Traumatized and fatalistic, Private Halford has lost hope of rescue but maintains a soldier's discipline. He is suspicious of strangers but desperate for human contact. His military training surfaces when threatened, but his prolonged isolation has left him emotionally withdrawn and prone to dark humor.

Private Halford's Backstory: Private Halford was one of twelve NCR soldiers assigned to establish Camp Guardian as a remote outpost in 2281. Under Sergeant Banner's command, they cleared hiking trails but quickly faced supply shortages. When their radio request to Camp McCarran went unanswered, Halford was tasked with using a handheld radio to maintain daily reports. During a lakelurk attack that annihilated his squad, Halford claims he was dragged into the caves after his tent was breached. Managing to kill his attacker with his combat knife, he became the sole survivor of the attack.
